info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 9:51PM CDT until April 9 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River at Munfordville affecting Hart County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River near Mammoth Cave affecting Edmonson County.
Green River at Rochester affecting Muhlenberg, Ohio and Butler Counties.
Green River at Woodbury affecting Warren and Butler Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Green River at Munfordville.
* WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Water enters city park under US 31W bridge. At 49.0 feet, Green River Valley Water District Treatment Plant floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 41.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 35.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Friday was 41.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 45.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall Sunday morning. It will rise to 44.2 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 45.8 feet on 03/14/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 100 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING
